concise_definition: n. 骡子, 固执的人, 走私者

definitions.explanation_en: A hybrid animal born from the mating of a male donkey and a female horse, known for its strength, endurance, and sure-footedness, often used as a beast of burden.
definitions.explanation_cn: 由公驴和母马交配产生的杂交动物，以力量大、耐力强和步履稳健著称，常被用作负重牲畜。
definitions.example_en: The farmers relied on mules to carry heavy loads up the mountain trails.
definitions.example_cn: 农民们依靠骡子将重物运上山间小道。

definitions.explanation_en: A person who is stubborn and refuses to change their mind or behavior, even when presented with good reasons to do so.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指固执己见、即使有充分理由也不愿改变想法或行为的人。
definitions.example_en: He’s a mule when it comes to quitting smoking—he won’t listen to anyone.
definitions.example_cn: 他在戒烟这件事上特别固执，谁的话都听不进去。

definitions.explanation_en: A person who smuggles illegal goods, especially across borders, often by carrying them on their person.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指走私非法物品的人，尤其是通过随身携带的方式跨越边境进行运输的人。
definitions.example_en: The drug cartel used mules to transport cocaine across the border.
definitions.example_cn: 毒品贩子雇佣走私者将可卡因运过边境。

comparison.analysis: “Donkey”（驴）是纯种动物，而 “mule” 是驴与马的杂交后代。虽然两者都象征固执，但 “donkey” 更常用于口语中表示愚蠢或笨拙，而 “mule” 强调顽固不化，带有更强的贬义和意志层面的抗拒。
“Stubborn”（固执的）是形容词，描述一种性格特质；而 “mule” 是名词，可直接指代这样的人，具有更强的形象性和隐喻性。用 “mule” 指人比用 “stubborn person” 更生动、更具文学色彩。
“Smuggler”（走私者）是泛指所有从事走私活动的人，而 “mule” 是其一种特定类型，特指那些亲自携带货物、不使用交通工具的低层走私者。它更强调身体运输的方式，常带有底层、被利用的语义色彩。
